title: MS AccessUCase()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessUCase()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Convert the text in "CustomerName" to upper-case:
SELECT UCASE(CustomerName) AS UppercaseCustomerName
FROM Customers;

Definition and Usage
The UCase() function converts a string to upper-case.
Tip:
Also look at the
LCase()
function.
Syntax
UCase(
text
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
text
Required. The string to convert
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000

❯
★
+1

content_sections.code:

FROM Customers;

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessUCase()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessUCase()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessUCase()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
